name: NeurIPS 2024 LLM Privacy Challenge
description: Address privacy risks in large language models (LLMs) through attacking privacy vulnerabilities (Red Team) or defending against privacy attacks (Blue Team).

cr:input.name: competition_dataset
cr:input.description: Synthetic datasets inspired by real-world private datasets, such as Enron emails, with sensitive fields replaced by random strings. Example: Original data: 'John Doe, johndoe@example.com'; Synthetic version: 'RandomName123, randomemail456@example.com'. Includes training, validation, and test splits.

cr:output.name: predictions
cr:output.description: Outputs depend on the track: Red Team outputs extracted sensitive information (e.g., names, email addresses); Blue Team outputs enhanced LLMs or defense methods evaluated for privacy protection and utility.

field.name: id
field.description: Unique identifier for the sample, e.g., 'sample_001'

field.name: output
field.description: Red Team: Extracted sensitive information (e.g., 'John Doe, johndoe@example.com'). Blue Team: Defense method or enhanced LLM description.

cr:evaluation.notes: Attack accuracy measures success rate of extracting sensitive information (Red Team). Defense effectiveness measures reduction in attack accuracy (Blue Team). Efficiency evaluates computational overhead. Model effectiveness assesses LLM utility post-defense.

open_questions: What are the exact runtime and memory limits for submissions?
What are the specific dataset URLs for downloading the synthetic datasets?
What are the exact software versions required for the standardized environment?
fill_in_the_blank: cr:input[0].url - dataset URL not specified in paper

cr:execution.memoryLimitMb - memory limit not specified in paper
